JobTitle: VP, Fleet Operations (Remote - Based anywhere in US)
JobFullDesc: At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.  As a Vice President, Fleet Operations for Pitney Bowes, you can too.We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate. We are actively looking for prospects who: Are passionate about client success. Enjoy collaborating with others. Strive to exceed expectations Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutionsIf this sounds like you, then you may be a great fit for Pitney Bowes You are: An exceptional people leader with an entrepreneurial mindset. A strategic leader with a “big picture” mindset who can shift between operational and strategic work and problem solve with the team. You possess a proven track record for scaling complex operations while focusing on the customer experience and controlling costs. You have led operations through rapid growth and delivered significant and meaningful results.You will: Make recommendations on process and/or procedure improvements needed, driving profitable growth in the Commerce services business unit.  Define, deploy and lead the strategy for the integrated domestic transportation team with a focus on flawless execution, growth and cost controls. Lead and develop a team of transportation managers. Use data-driven decision-making to deliver meaningful results that align with the overall transportation strategy. Identify areas of opportunity to insource transportation lanes, using data and analytics to support cost savings and service improvement and opportunities through in-sourcing to the PB Fleet. Monitor expenses by reviewing financial data with period comparison dashboards. Analyze trends and expense drivers like: fuel, accessorial, zones and weight classes. Create a safety-first culture by ensuring DOT compliance, on-going driver training and by partnering with operational leadership within our facilities. Get line-of-sight into your carrier services by reviewing on-time performance metrics, spend trends, cost per package averages and air/ground utilization details. Manage vendor compliance to reduce fraud. Review monthly Metrics Scorecard with VP/GM  (Set goals for cost savings).QualificationsYour background: As a Vice President, Fleet Operations, you have: 10+ years of experience in the transportation industry, with at least some experience in truckload, LTL, parcels and courier. 5-7 years in Supply Chain Management, Pricing or routing- optimization. Audit experience with ability to document all findings in a concise and comprehensive manner. Advanced level skills with Microsoft Suite applications. Excellent organization skills, proven written and verbal communication skills.We will  Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career  Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas    Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com) Our TeamPitney Bowes Global Commerce services provides a comprehensive range of domestic and global commerce and cross-border shipping solutions that help U.S. U.K. and Australian businesses, retailers and online marketplaces reach consumers around the world from postcard to package.  Pitney Bowes, a market leader in global commerce solutions, continues to expand and grow its digital commerce businesses.Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace. W/M/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBT are encouraged to apply.  All interested individuals must apply online.
